intro: Cephaelis domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Dominica and other islands in the Lesser Antilles. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the top of the stems. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Cephaelis domingensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
